channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Piling up of waste attracting foxes, 12th November
item.description:
Garbage bags are piling up since weeks creating unpleasant smells and attracting foxes and rodents. The bags are teared open and waste starts to fly around the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Princess May Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement outside SoHo coffee in 55 Baker Street is uneven and cracked and it poses a trip hazard to the members of the public., 12th November
item.description:
The pavement outside SoHo coffee in 55 Baker Street is uneven and cracked and it poses a trip hazard to the members of the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Baker Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Thames water repair failing, 12th November
item.description:
Thames water recently duck up the pavement to repair a valve the pavement is now sinking around that valve

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palm Avenue, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Telecommunication pole cabinet open, 12th November
item.description:
The telecommunication pole cabinet does not have a cabinet door and each time someone works on it they just put tape round it. It needs a new cabinet door attached as the tape breaks off and all the wires are exposed as shown in the photo. This is at the joining roads of Brixham Road and Tenby Road in Welling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gipsy Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole, 12th November
item.description:
Very deep pothole at the junction just as you start to go across the lights, hard to avoid and will do damage to cars if wheel goes down it, but could cause accident as cars trying to avoid it. Has been filled with grit last year but that has now all come loose. when it is dark it is hard to see it, cars seeing it last minute and swerve to avoid. if turning right at the lights it is hard to avoid
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewisham Way, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lane, 12th November
item.description:
The cycle lane has disappeared (not visible anymore) and car/van drivers are getting very aggressive when cycling down that road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Featherstone Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned red Ford Fiesta, 12th November
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle without MOT and incorrectly SORN on public road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keeble Close, Plumstead

item.title: Street light 245/06 at entrance to King's Stairs Gardens from Mayflower Street not working., 12th November
item.description:
Street light needs to be fixed. Plus the two other local problems that have been reported, but not dealt with: (a) streetlight 246/01 on King Stairs Close, reported in Feb 2025, and (b) the 'strobe-effect' lighting on the Thames Pathway behind King Stairs Close. If these issues are not dealt with, the next step for us residents will be councillors and the MP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, King Stairs Close, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large white graffiti, 12th November
item.description:
New white graffiti spanning around 10m long. Recently done, needs removing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Lawrie Park Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Budgens completely covered in graffiti, 12th November
item.description:
Whole shop front has been covered in graffiti along one side and around the corners. Can it all be covered over with the same paint colour to bring uniformity back and remove it please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Scena Way, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking access to dropped kerb and pavement crossing, 12th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Charterhouse Street, London

item.title: Fly tipping - consistently., 12th November
item.description:
Over flowing bins + fly tipping. A consistent problem. There are 4 dark grey bins (no numbers on them) and one brown bin all full of stinky overflowing rubbish. Hence encouraging more dumping… Please can we request all these bins are removed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barbauld Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves obstructing pavements and dangerous over all the curbs, 12th November
item.description:
The roads must be cleared of leaves as soon as possible. They are piling up, full of rubbish, dog poo and all sorts. They’re also very dangerous when wet, slippery and make the curbs unclear causing pedestrians and buggies to trip over curbs and get stuck.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath not cleaned, 12th November
item.description:
The footpaths are not clean. They are full of leaves from the trees and people cannot walk properly especially wheelchairs, parents with buggies etc. can this be cleaned.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Village, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet
